# <a href="https://play.picoctf.org/practice/challenge/73">miniRSA</a>

![s21483606062025](https://a.okmd.dev/md/684314de76d8e.png)  
This was a cute challenge to be solved.

After downloading the cipher text, this was what I had:
```
N: 
e: 3

ciphertext (c): 2205316413931134031074603746928247799030155221252519872649649212867614751848436763801274360463406171277838056821437115883619169702963504606017565783537203207707757768473109845162808575425972525116337319108047893250549462147185741761825125 
```

I went to the wiki and with the help of that, I made a python script that I could use to get out the plain text:
```Python
def cubeRoot(x):
    low, high = 0, x
    while low < high:
        mid = (low + high) // 2
        if mid ** 3 < x:
            low = mid + 1
        else:
            high = mid
    return low
N = 
e = 3
c = 2205316413931134031074603746928247799030155221252519872649649212867614751848436763801274360463406171277838056821437115883619169702963504606017565783537203207707757768473109845162808575425972525116337319108047893250549462147185741761825125
m = cubeRoot(c)
mb = m.to_bytes((m.bit_length() + 7) // 8, 'big')
try:
    plaintext = mb.decode('utf-8')
except UnicodeDecodeError:
    plaintext = mb.decode('latin-1')
print(plaintext)
```

After running the program, this was what I was left with:
```
picoCTF{n33d_a_lArg3r_e_606ce004}
``` 
on the terminal window.
Thus the challenge was solved!

### Answer:
```
picoCTF{n33d_a_lArg3r_e_606ce004}
```
### References:
- <a href="www.programiz.com/python-programming/online-compiler/">Online Python</a>
